tweet: You can check your voter status, and find contact information for your Municipal Clerk, by logging in to your unique MyVoterPage at  https://t.co/Foy25lcIKo. #VT #VTPoli #ReadyToVote

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: Your #VT town may be one of several that still has local issue elections coming up. Make sure to check with your Town or City Clerk so that you know where and how you can vote!  https://t.co/Q7z1GLv1tS

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: Through new administrative rules, our Office of Professional Regulation has an enhanced ability to consider education and training obtained outside the U.S. to make it easier for New Americans and Refugees to join the licensed workforce. Learn more:  https://t.co/rrZcvD6Fu3

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: The #1 mission of our Office of Professional Regulation is protection of the public. We aim to find the right-fit regulation necessary to accomplish that mission, while reducing barriers to licensure for #VT professionals. Read more about recent reforms:  https://t.co/E3fr2JNHeT

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: This #SCOTUS may have to make some high profile voter rights decisions for many Americans before 2024. We need pro-voter Justices, like the highly qualified Ketanji Brown Jackson on the bench fighting for fairness and democracy. #ProtectTheVote

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: Do you have questions about getting on the ballot to run for office in the upcoming August 9th #VT Statewide Primary Elections? Start by checking the info & resources on our website at  https://t.co/0FFkf3IQjx.  Running for office is a great way to serve your community! #VTPoli

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: Puppies AND voter registration? How could it get any better?!  What if we told you in #VT, you can check your registration status, register if necessary, affirm your registration info, request a primary ballot by mail & find Town Clerk contact info all at  https://t.co/Foy25lcIKo?  https://t.co/6BNsTN2iad

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: "Despite widespread claims that the 2020 election was fraudulent or poorly managed, election administration did not just persevere under unexpected & challenging conditions—it improved."-Claire DeSoi, @MITelectionlab   Oh, did we mention #VT's ranked #1?😎  https://t.co/9BZUuP6x87

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: As we close out #SunshineWeek 2022 remember that the obligations of government to be transparent aren't just for 1 week of the year: that obligation is 24/7/365.  Open meetings and public records access aren't just good practices, they're the law. #OpenGov  https://t.co/07vTi88cBB

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: Secretary Condos & Deputy Secretary Winters had the pleasure of chatting with @GNATtelevision's Andrew McKeever about #SunshineWeek & #VT's #OpenGov transparency laws.  Government must be guided by the simple principle that the people have a right to know!  https://t.co/ldZi3nc4A3

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: "Government transparency, through open meetings & public records access, ensures ‘we the people’ have the tools necessary to verify our government officials are acting in our best interests & hold them accountable if we believe they are not." #SunshineWeek  https://t.co/07vTi8pO0b

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: There’s a filing deadline TODAY for BOTH campaign finance & lobbyist disclosure. Reports can be filed/viewed at  https://t.co/9FcxvFd5xI or  https://t.co/SKH7OoQNaq. Knowing how money’s spent to influence the #VTPoli  process is a critical #OpenGov transparency tool. #SunshineWeek  https://t.co/sJuseFbXdj

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: According to a recent @BrennanCenter report, 1 in 5 local election officials are unlikely to return to their positions assisting democracy. The threats and intimidation are serving only to drive away good pollworkers, who deserve our praise and gratitude.  https://t.co/zfg1YnevAA

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: @PapaCranks Agreed. 1. There are too many exemptions laced through-out statute. They should be consolidated/narrowed. 2. An OpenGov ombuds could go a long way, if given the independence, resources &  authority necessary, & 3. Our belief is the law does apply to leg., but it's not up to us.

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: Fair and free elections are as American as apple pie, so on this #PiDay grab a slice with some #VT cheddar to help us celebrate #VT's #1 IN THE COUNTRY ranking for election administration in the #2020 #ElectionPerformance Index via @MITelectionlab.  More:  https://t.co/PWUWhCVkMA.  https://t.co/1Zr24sUKv5

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: It's our favorite week of the year: #SunshineWeek which serves as a reminder that in gov't the ultimate boss is the public & the public has a right to know!  Read more from longtime transparency/#OpenGov advocates SOS Jim Condos & Deputy SOS Chris Winters:  https://t.co/zMbYyNEb1p

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: We are very proud to announce: for the 2nd Presidential election in a row #VT elections ranked 1st nationally on the @MITelectionlab #ElectionsPerformance Index!  We'll have a full statement soon. Credit due to our small but mighty elections team, & VT's hard working Town Clerks.

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: We look forward to producing a report on the subject, to help the Leg. answer this Q. “We want people to practice at the top of their scope of practice. Essential to that question is whether they are trained & qualified to provide those services.” -OPR Director Lauren Hibbert 2/2

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: Curious about the topics our Office of Professional Regulation tracks in the Legislature? He's a quick look in to one. The big Q at hand: should scope of practice be expanded for optometrists to cover some surgeries? (1/2) #VTPoli  https://t.co/l5AIxWNwbG

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: Establishing a statewide Code of Ethics will be a meaningful step forward, but more work needs to be done for meaningful ethics reform.  The Ethics Commission must be given the authority and the resources (staffing) to uphold it. #VTPoli  https://t.co/Vl4BOYKFOQ

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: ICYMI: #VT is also now a member of the Nurse Licensure Compact, which will further streamline the process qualified nurses from other states must go through to start caring for VT patients, giving providers new tools to address workforce shortages. #VTPoli  https://t.co/4yodiSgpvG

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: "A few states seem to have figured out the art of short-order licensing. Nurses moving to [VT] last year got their licenses in just one day."  Our smart licensing reforms help qualified pro's enter the workforce quickly while protecting the public. #VTPoli  https://t.co/ZaVYOpYjrT

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: As states like #VT increasingly utilize #VoteByMail options, the USPS will play a growing fundamental role in the democratic process.  We must do everything we can to ensure this critical public service remains viable. This is a good first step. #SaveUSPS  https://t.co/mMkpGBx4Mo

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: Time and time again courageous women have led the charge on major voting rights advancements in our country.  On #InternationalWomensDay we look back on their legacy, so that we may honor it by looking forward with the foresight that there's still work to do. #RestoreTheVote  https://t.co/Ek3bUZRzxq

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: It has been 57 years to the day since Selma's 'Bloody Sunday,' & voting rights for some Americans are still under attack.  As we commemorate #Selma57 we must also demand action from Congress to #RestoreTheVRA & #FightForTheVote, & put an end to state attacks on voting rights.

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: On this day in 1791 the 1st Federal Congress admitted #VT as the 14th state in the United States.  Happy Birthday, Vermont!  https://t.co/SXvHDssFwT

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: The laws that govern our democracy are designed to prevent the abuse of power from those who would seek to overturn the will of the people. We must work together to strengthen the institutions which ensure 'one person-one vote' remains the law of the land.  https://t.co/tJAzcRDmpo

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: Reminder: the Secretary of State's office will not have #TownMeetingDay2022 election results. Interested parties will have to get those from the Towns/Town Clerks directly.

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: Happy #TownMeetingDay! So far, so good with no major issues to report. A little snow isn't going to stop our dedicated elections team from staying late to support our dedicated town clerks with their local elections. #vtpoli  https://t.co/ADIgDi15IF

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: Have you voted yet? There's still time to get to the polls to participate in #TownMeetingDay2022.  From wastewater removal to school budgets, town charters, municipal bonds, or any number of other policies, local elections always have such important items on the ballot. Vote!  https://t.co/MYYbqHDBW1

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: It's Town Meeting Day - one of our favorite days of the year!  Log in to  https://t.co/Foy25lcIKo to verify your polling place, then make sure you have a plan to vote today. Local democracy needs you! #BeAVoter #TownMeetingDay2022 #VT #VTPoli  https://t.co/wuguLqrKnV

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: Today SOS Condos is presenting at the @NASSorg virtual #NASSCon on the important licensing reform we're doing through our Office of Professional Regulation.  Our goal is to find the minimum right-fit regulation necessary to protect the public & grow our workforce.  https://t.co/K2rXznEdTo

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: In #VT #TownMeetingDay2022 traditions are as varied as the issues being voted on. This @vtdigger articles describes many of the important issues VT towns are voting on:  https://t.co/DydJueMssj  Make sure you vote tomorrow, or when #TMD2022 takes place for your town! #VTPoli

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: For most #VT towns, tomorrow is #TownMeetingDay2022! name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: #Vermont's own Will Senning in the upper right of this 8-pack of election administrator excellence.

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: In #VT Town Meeting Day voting, no matter the method, allows us to join with our neighbors to select a path forward for our communities.  For most towns, #TownMeetingDay2022 is just around the corner, next Tuesday (March 1st). Make your voting plan today! #BeAVoter  https://t.co/2fFYndaZMD

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: Membership in the Nurse Licensure Compact enables rapid onboarding of vetted competent nurses into #VT HC facilities at a time when the need has never been greater. It's 1 of a package of reforms designed to grow our workforce & protect the public. #VTPoli  https://t.co/4yodiRYOE8

tweet: What are your #TownMeetingDay2022 voting plans? name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: Per @BrennanCenter over 250 bills aimed at restricting voting rights have been introduced in 27 states, compared to 75 at this time last year.  In #VT we will continue to stand strong against any efforts to restrict the Constitutional rights of voters.  https://t.co/2ebHRgSWyT

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: Did you miss Secretary Condos' retirement announcement yesterday? You can view his full remarks at  https://t.co/mOfIYQq9UD.  "For me, the end result of the work of government should always be to improve the health, safety, and lives of all residents." - SOS Condos #VTPoli

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: Today Secretary Condos announced he will be retiring after 12 years as Secretary of State & over 35 years of public service.  His legacy will include universal vote by mail & transforming the SoS office from paper driven to a digital environment. #VTPoli  https://t.co/Szj5bNAnMS

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: This video is sickening. An election conspiracist saying election officials he believes (with 0 evidence) are involved in fraud "deserve to hang," met with cheers from the crowd.  These aren't only violent threats to our election officials, they are threats to our democracy.

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: There are already more bills aimed at restricting voting introduced in Legislatures across the country than there were at this same time last year.  The trials facing our democracy aren't over & we have work to do to protect the rights of American voters.  https://t.co/h9WxYc7ivV

tweet: In 2020/2021 over 200 Vermonters reported $2million+ in losses from home improvement fraud or negligent work. Unacceptable. name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: Across the country, even here in #VT, election officials are being targeted with death threats fueled by the #TheBigLie.  Enough is enough. No one should have to fear for their safety or the safety of their loved ones for their work serving our democracy.  https://t.co/Nhqb4ooF9N

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: @CounselorAdrian @parade_mairead We have to meet statutory req's of 3 V.S.A. 131. In doing so we aim for an appropriate balance between rehabilitation/return to safe practice that meets standards of care and transparent protection of the public regarding their right to know if a licensee has been disciplined.

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: On this day in 1870 the #FifteenthAmendment was ratified prohibiting the denial of voting rights based on race.  It took nearly 100 years for this to become further actualized by the #VotingRightsAct, yet voter suppression is eroding this promise even today. #ProtectVotingRights.

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: H.157 would require 3 things: registration, a contract and insurance for jobs over $3500. Home improvement fraud is one of the top complaints received by @VTAttorneyGen's consumer protection division.

tweet: Nice summary of H.157, a registration system to address the consumer protection issue of home improvement fraud. We don't take regulation of a new profession lightly and it should only be done when necessary to protect the public.   https://t.co/3yXXfhtt80

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: This new process not only breaks down barriers to the workforce for new Vermonters - it is a key economic development tool, and will help the Green Mountain State address workforce shortages in critical professions. #VT #VTPoli

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: The location of one’s past professional experience alone shouldn't be a barrier to licensure. Our new Foreign Credentialing Rules make it easier for New Americans, refugees & others with experience outside of the U.S. to work in their chosen field in VT.  https://t.co/AOW19GZI1X

name: Vermont Secretary of State’s Office
tweet: After record-breaking voter turnout (with scant evidence of fraud) in 2020, why are we now seeing state after state restricting early voting, mail voting, drop boxes, & voter friendly measures like drive thru & 24hr voting? We need basic protections. #JohnLewisVotingRightsAct
